Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.view

Class CLI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.UI
it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.CLI
public class CLI
extends UI
Class that deals with user interaction through command line. It has some methods that support CLI state to manage player input due to high complexity of client messages. It uses client as a gateway thanks to which adapt what user see on the screen.

  • Field Summary

  • Method Details

    • askInstructionsOnHowToTakeResources

      public java.util.Map<ResourceSource,​java.util.EnumMap<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer>> askInstructionsOnHowToTakeResources​(java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> neededResources)
      Returns a map containing information about how to take resources from warehouse. Since the player has the possibility of pick resources from NormalDepot, ExtraDepot or Strongbox this method is used to set for each occurrence, for each resources type, from where it has to be taken.
      Parameters:
      neededResources - map that establishes how many occurrences are needed for each resource type.

    • showPossibleSources

      private void showPossibleSources​(java.util.Map<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer> neededResources, boolean availableExtraDepot)
      Allows the player to see from where he can get resources to perform his action.
      Parameters:
      neededResources - map that establishes how many occurrences are needed for each resource type.
      availableExtraDepot - establishes if the player has any kind of ExtraDepot.

    • initializeHowToTakeResources

      private java.util.Map<ResourceSource,​java.util.EnumMap<ResourceType,​java.lang.Integer>> initializeHowToTakeResources()
      Initializes map containing information about how to get resources from player's warehouse.
      Returns:
      resulting map.

      maxIndex - maximum index that can be selected.
      Returns:

    • askValidOcc

      public int askValidOcc​(java.util.Scanner input, int maxOcc)

      Parameters:

      maxOcc - maximum number that can be selected.
      Returns:
      number selected by player.

    • returnToMenu

      public void returnToMenu()
      Method used when player has or needs to go back at action choice phase. (For example after ensuring that a previously selected action cannot be performed due to lack of resources).
